item.description:
Description: Almost 1,000 forested acres with light hiking with some hills. Interesting surface mining features worth exploring from long ago that are 3 gully-like features. Some tails go down to and along the Connecticut River. After the hike, those who wish to can meet up at a restaurant for dinner in Portland area.

Duration: The hike will be 2 hours and will cover about 3.4 miles on the outer loop of trails. A marked map will be posted in the “Saturday, Feb. 18 Hike to Hurd State Park, CT” hike thread in the Message Board.

Time: Meet at the Park at 1 PM. The hike will be over at about 3 PM. Dinner from about 3:30 PM at the restaurant.

Park Information at:
http://dep.state.ct.u... (or click the link below.)
Trail Map at:
http://dep.state.ct.u...

Carpool: Some carpooling is available. Anyone who wishes to carpool or to provide carpool services, please post your request/offer in the hike thread in the Message Board.

Parking: Parking will be at the pavilion. If there is any snow or ice on the road, parking will likely have to be on the road shoulder, as the road up to the pavilion gets very icy. I'll say more as to where we can all park later.

Comments/Questions: Please post in the hike thread in the Message Board or e-mail Kevin S, the hike organizer.

(Do not pay via PayPal for carpool.)

A map marked for this hike can be found at (members only can see):
http://files.meetup.c...

Directions from Hartford area:
1. Take I-91 South.
2. Take Exit 22S onto CT-9 South (5.5 miles).
3. Take Exit 16 to Middletown, CT-17/ST. JOHN’S SQ. Go around sharp curve and onto the bridge over Connecticut River (1.1 miles).
4. After the bridge, take RIGHT following CT-66 East (5.0 miles).
5. In Cobalt, take RIGHT onto CT-151 (2.5 miles).
6. At stoplight, take RIGHT FORK onto Hurd Park Rd (about 0.3 miles)
7. Park entrance will be on right.
8. Follow park road to RIGHT side road to the pavilion.

For more information, see http://dep.state.ct.u...
